meanings.definition: To treat or combine with phenol.
meanings.sent1: She is phenolating the wood to protect it from insects.
meanings.sent2: The chemist is phenolating the solution to enhance its properties.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally spilled phenol while phenolating the furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her care and attention to detail in phenolating the fabric made it last longer.
meanings.sent5: The process of phenolating the metal made it resistant to corrosion.

meanings.definition: The act of adding phenol to a substance.
meanings.sent1: The phenolating of the medicine improved its effectiveness.
meanings.sent2: He observed the phenolating of the liquid in the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The sudden phenolating of the soup with extra spices surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The phenolating of the paint with a new color created a unique shade.
meanings.sent5: The careful phenolating of the mixture resulted in a perfect blend.

meanings.definition: The process of phenolating a compound.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the phenolating of chemicals requires proper training.
meanings.sent2: The factory has a specific area dedicated to the phenolating of compounds.
meanings.sent3: The automated phenolating of the ingredients saved time in the production.
meanings.sent4: The continuous phenolating of the solution led to a breakthrough discovery.
meanings.sent5: The precise phenolating of the elements resulted in a stable compound.
